reviews.productTitle: Leviton 6526-W 15-Amp 120V AC Combination Decora Switch with LED Guide Light, White
reviews.text: I have 3 of these now, some dating back awhile. So far, I have seen no degradation of the bulb brightness, so I am confident enough to buy additional units where needed. The brightness in my opinion is just a little lacking, but it is adequate to find your way in the middle of the night. There is a third connection which must go to the white neutral wire to get the light to come on. Check your outlet box prior to ordering to see if white wires are present. Sometimes, they are not available in switch boxes. There is also a ground connection which you should attach to the bare ground wires. Although not technically correct, if you attach the bare ground wires to the neutral (white) terminal, the led will light. This is not to code however. Another workaround is to connect the non-hot wire going to the device to the neutral terminal, and depending on the device connected, this may provide enough ground to power the light but only when the switch is in the off position. (for example, an incandescent light bulb will have a low enough resistance to provide a return path when switch is in the off position only.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.title: No problems so far with bulb life

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 6526-W 15-Amp 120V AC Combination Decora Switch with LED Guide Light, White
reviews.text: Works as described. I installed it in a dark garage to control an outside light. You can see in my picture that I wrote the word "ON" under the switch on the right side as a reminder because the light it controls is located outside of the garage/not visible from the switch area, and I'm used to switches toggling up/down not left/right. The nightlight in the switch is not as bright as some of those adjustable rounded nightlights that plug into an electric outlet, but the light in this switch does glow enough to dimly light the immediate area near it in the garage, which is certainly better than total darkness. When on, you can see the 2 little LEDs located behind that whitish plate at the top of the switch, and they create a soft glow. (In the picture the light looks very bright in the dark, but in person it's more of a soft glow.) For my particular needs I wish it was brighter, but it's probably the perfect brightness for a bathroom switch for people who wake up in the middle of the night and don't want to turn on the bright bathroom lights. Installation was easy for me; I'm not an electrician. Some wall switches have little holes you can simply push the rigid wires into then the wires are automatically clamped into place, but this switch does not have those so you must wrap the electric wires around the screws. The screws are colored: brass screw by itself on one side of the switch for the black hot wire that is supplying power into the switch, on the other side of the switch is another brass screw for the black load wire that sends power out to the item being controlled (my outside light) then a silver screw for the white neutral wire, then a green screw for the ground wire. You must have a white/neutral wire for this switch/nightlight to work properly. If you do not know how to safely tell the difference between the 2 black wires (one is the hot wire that always has power to it; the other carries power to the item the switch controls) then I suggest you seek help...safety first as always. The instructions that are included in the box with this switch are good and have much more detail than I listed here.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2021
reviews.title: Decora wall switch with nightlight installed

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 6526-W 15-Amp 120V AC Combination Decora Switch with LED Guide Light, White
reviews.text: I had purchased another, similar type switch that comes in pairs, but this one is better. I wish I had purchased these to begin with because I changed out a number of light switches throughout our house. Unfortunately I used the other type for most of them. These are more expensive; one costs as much as a pair of the other type. But if you buy switches in pairs, install one, but the other is bad, what do you do? For me I'm not going to remove the good switch and return the pair, I'll just chuck the bad one. But I have not had a bad one of these so far and I have maybe 5 or 6.

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 6526-W 15-Amp 120V AC Combination Decora Switch with LED Guide Light, White
reviews.text: Follow the instructions! This device needs to be hooked into a white neutral for the LED to work. The hot and the load line needs to be the correct position. Many of the one star reviews didn't get this correct so it didn't work or isn't working properly. Install was more difficult than I anticipated. Once working, this product works well. Great for bathroom light where there is no additional outlet. Light is plenty bright. Quality is good.

reviews.title: Harder to install, but good once working

reviews.productTitle: Leviton 6526-W 15-Amp 120V AC Combination Decora Switch with LED Guide Light, White
reviews.text: I have installed three of these nightlight switches to replace the fan switches in my bathrooms. The nightlight is powered by two 120V LEDs that are bright! No need to turn on a bathroom light in the middle of the night. For my taste, it would be better if the light cover did a better job of diffusing the light so you couldn't see the two LEDS, which are quite bright when you looked at directly. Installation is easy but did require me to add a common wire from the new switch to the other common wires in the junction box that were connected with a wire nut.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2019
reviews.title: Nightlight and a Switch
